{sc}standard{/sc} {sc}criterion{/sc} {sc}gauge{/sc} {sc}yardstick{/sc} {sc}touchstone{/sc} mean a means of determining what a thing should be. {sc}standard{/sc} applies to any definite rule, principle, or measure established by authority.
{sc}criterion{/sc} may apply to anything used as a test of quality whether formulated as a rule or principle or not.
{sc}gauge{/sc} applies to a means of testing a particular dimension (such as thickness, depth, diameter) or figuratively a particular quality or aspect.

pt.t: polls as a {it}gauge{/it} of voter dissatisfaction

pt: {sc}yardstick{/sc} is an informal substitute for {sc}criterion{/sc} that suggests quantity more often than quality.

pt.t: housing construction as a {it}yardstick{/it} of economic growth

pt: {sc}touchstone{/sc} suggests a simple test of the authenticity or value of something intangible.

pt.t: fine service is one {it}touchstone{/it} of a first-class restaurant
